description: Beginner German vocabulary - fundamental words and phrases

words.mnemonic: Sounds just like 'Hello' - wave and say it!

words.example: Guten Tag! Sch√∂n, Sie zu sehen.
words.mnemonic: 'Tag' sounds like 'day' - say it during daytime!
'Abend' sounds like 'evening' - the end of day!
'Wieder-sehen' = 'again-see' = until we see each other again!

words.exampleTranslation: My name is Maria. And you?

words.example: Hi Tom! Wie geht es dir heute?
words.exampleTranslation: Hi Tom! How are you today?

words.example: Guten Morgen! Wie geht es Ihnen?
Danke! Mir geht es sehr gut.

numbers.name: Numbers 0-100
numbers.description: Cardinal numbers from zero to one hundred

words.mnemonic: 'Drei' sounds like 'dry' - three suns = very dry!

words.example: Ich arbeite f√ºnf Tage pro Woche.
words.exampleTranslation: I work five days per week.
It's six o'clock in the morning.

words.example: Ich gehe um neun Uhr ins Bett.
words.exampleTranslation: I go to bed at nine o'clock.

words.example: Der Bus kommt in drei√üig Minuten.
words.exampleTranslation: The bus comes in thirty minutes.

words.example: Mein Vater ist vierzig Jahre alt.
words.exampleTranslation: My father is forty years old.
The book has one hundred pages.

words.mnemonic: 'Rot' rhymes with 'hot' - red is a hot color! üî•
'Orange' is the same in both languages! üçä

family.name: Family Members (Familie)
family.grammarNote: German nouns have genders! 'der' = masculine, 'die' = feminine, 'das' = neuter

words.exampleTranslation: My father works in the office.

words.example: Ihr Sohn ist zehn Jahre alt.
words.exampleTranslation: Her son is ten years old.
The children play in the park.
My grandfather likes to read the newspaper.

words.example: Wir besuchen unsere Gro√üeltern am Sonntag.
words.exampleTranslation: We visit our grandparents on Sunday.

verbs.name: Basic Verbs (Grundverben)
verbs.grammarNote: German verbs change their endings based on the subject. This is called 'conjugation'.

words.mnemonic: The most important verb - you 'be' who you are!

words.exampleTranslation: I drink coffee in the morning.
The fish swims in the water.

words.mnemonic: 'K√§se' sounds like 'case' - a case of cheese!

words.example: Das Buch liegt auf dem Tisch.
words.exampleTranslation: The book is on the table.

words.mnemonic: 'Stuhl' sounds like 'stool' - a type of chair!

days_months.name: Days & Months (Tage & Monate)
days_months.description: Days of the week and months of the year

words.exampleTranslation: On Monday I go to work.
Wednesday is the middle of the week.

body_parts.name: Body Parts (K√∂rperteile)
body_parts.description: Parts of the body in German
